tool.name: SOAPpileup
tool.command:
soappileup.py
## Inputs --ref=$ref --sorted_soap=$sorted_soap --regions=$regions
## Check if using default or custom parameters --default_full_settings_type=$default_full_settings.settings_type
#if $default_full_settings.settings_type == "full" --discard_uncovered_loci=$default_full_settings.discard_uncovered_loci --regions_sorted=$default_full_settings.regions_sorted --read_edge_length=$default_full_settings.read_edge_length --region_limited=$default_full_settings.region_limited #end if
## Output file --output=$output

param.help: Reference should be in Fasta format and compressed into a .gz file
param.label: Reference sequence file
param.name: ref

param.help: This file can be generated using SOAP1 or SOAP2, and compressed into a .gz file
param.label: A sorted SOAP file
param.name: sorted_soap

param.help: Default settings are suitable for most analyses. If you want full control, use Full parameter list
param.label: SOAPpileup settings to use
param.name: settings_type

param.label: Are regions already sorted and combined (not overlapped with others)?
param.name: regions_sorted

param.label: Number of base pairs at the 5' and 3' ends to be defined as the read edge
param.name: read_edge_length

param.label: Region limited (region will be split into smaller ones)
param.name: region_limited

tool.help:
**What it does**
SOAPpileup is a tool for summarizing the base calls of aligned reads to a reference sequence. This tool performs a step required for SOAPsnv in the detection somatic mutation of single nucleotide variant (SNV) by re-sequencing. Together SOAPpileup, there are three other tools required in the SOAPsnv process: SNVtest, alleleQC and SNVdetect.
**More information**
For test data and more detailed information, click here_.
.. _here: http://soap.genomics.org.cn/SOAPsnv.html
